sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p:
ST SEBASTIAΝ, a handſome, populous, and ſtrong town of Spain, in the province of Guipuſcoa, with a good and well frequented harbour. It is ſeated at the foot of a mountain; and the harbour ſecured by two moles, and a narrow entrance for the ſhips. The town is ſurrourrded with a double wall, and to the ſea-ſide is fortified with baſtions and half moons. The ſtreets are long, broad, and ſtraight, and paved with white flag- ſtones. At the top of the mountain is a citadel, with a garriſon well ſurniſhed with cannon. The town carries on a conſiderable trade, the greateſt part of which conſiſts of iron and ſteel, which ſome reckon to be the beſt in Europe. They alſo deal in wool, which comes
from Old Caſtile. W. Long. 1. 59 . N. Lat. 43. 23.— The capital of Braſil in South America is likewiſe called Sebaſtian.
